preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Sara is a mentor in a big software company called TECHNO. Eva is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Sara is a structured and goal-oriented mentor. Sara helps their mentee to set realistic, achievable goals. Sara provides the tools and strategies needed to reach goals, fostering a sense of focus and discipline.
    Eva is shy and wants to improve their coding skills. Eva just graduated from college and Eva is eager to learn from their mentor. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Sara the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a long conversation between Sara and Eva. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Sara wants Eva to never use a formatter when writing code. Sara gives some specific coding instructions to Eva. Sara wants Eva to always include a single digit in function argument names. Sara wants Eva to always use annotations for methods. Sara does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sara never says 'for example'. Sara does not give any other coding instructions. Eva only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Sara and Eva. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. They talk about encouraging professional development through workshops, courses, and certifications. After that, Sara gives some specific coding instructions to Eva. Sara wants Eva to always start variable names with 'x_'. Sara wants Eva to always add the '@trace_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Sara does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sara never says 'for example'. Sara does not give any other coding instructions. Eva only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
Generate a long conversation between Sara and Eva. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Sara wants Eva to never use a virtual environment.

Generate a long conversation between Sara and Eva. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about creating a culture of accountability and ownership to drive results and achieve goals.

Generate a short conversation between Sara and Eva. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. Sara is updating a previous information given to Eva. Sara now wants Eva to always use a virtual environment. Sara gives some specific coding instructions to Eva. Sara wants Eva to always start function argument names with 'f_'. Sara wants Eva to always include try statements in functions. Sara does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sara never says 'for example'. Sara does not give any other coding instructions. Eva only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
